Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: canth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is certainly one of the least expensive hotels in the Financial District / Seaport area. I should know since my company has put up many employees here over the years and the prices are consistently among the lowest in the area. This weekend was my first stay here and I can say that it was a pleasant one. The checkin/checkout process was smooth, the room was clean and the services were good. My only problem was with a very loud guest across the hall - one call to the front desk and they were quiet for the rest of the night. I'd stay here again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: antionettebrantley
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell this hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff was great, hotel was clean and the price was excellent. The staff allowed us to check in early, upgrade our room and were super friendly with helping us navigate our way around NYC! Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Polite Staff, Fairly Priced.”
Reviews.Author: maddermaus
Reviews.Content: It was a trendy little boutique hotel. It's an older building that Was. renovated so if you're expecting a brand new upscale hotel, go to Trump Soho instead. I'll be returning here later this year. The staff was polite and helpful. The rooms had a really cool euro-retro vibe. The location is great if you have business in the area. There is a bar/club in the hotel, but I didn't go, maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice try but it did not deliver what was expected.”
Reviews.Author: ElaBizz
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at his location. We get there early on the first day to be told that our 2 double bed room was not possible. Even if I paid premium dollars to get 2 beds They claimed the computer did not pick it up. We were send to a room with a queen and a sofa bed. THE absolute WORST sofa bed ever. After a few ours of this nightmare we calmed down and negotiated for another room on the next day. As a peace offering we were given the Bfast free. Well all I have to say is that the price paid for this hotel was not worth it. Even the Bfast was a shame...nothing left at 9:30 in the morning except cereals and a lame piece of bread. Staff is very nice but no way does it compensate for the lack of comfort and upscale decor and room you had expected. Overall not going back. Also be aware that parking in. That area could be problematic as I encountered a few that did not work on holidays therefore no way to get your car back....

Reviews.Title: “A gloomy hotel in Wall Street”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoF
Reviews.Content: Expensive price, not in proportion with the expectations. We had a 2-nights reservation with clause for a twin beds room and we received an accomodation with double bed and folding bed: nobody informed us in advance of this change and they didn't make the minimum effort to solve the impasse (for example, giving us a symbolic discount on the rate). Reception desk staff not always present. Rooms are fairly spacious but bathroom need a restoration. A positive note is concerning the air-refresher in the elevators: tangerine hessence raised us the mood in the depressing atmosphere of this facility... More in general, it could be lethal for those that are already suffering for the crisis...

Reviews.Title: “Great location near subway with great value, minor inconveniences.”
Reviews.Author: bestabest
Reviews.Content: The overall stay was great. We were greeted by friendly staff upon check in. Finding the hotels parking garage upon arrival was a little hectic, as there are so many different options. The room was clean and updated. Everything was great except our toilet. We had a staff member try to fix it he was very friendly. We were a little in a rush so we left our room while he continued working on this. However, when we got back it was still clogged. If we stayed more than one might, this would have been a bigger issue. Besides that one detail, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Roomy Lower Manhattan Hotel with Great Staff and Some Flaws”
Reviews.Author: deltaskye
Reviews.Content: My client's travel agent booked me here, It was a 20 minute taxi ride from Penn Station. It's surrounded by scaffolding and on a one-way street; my taxi driver had to call his dispatcher to get directions. But it's one block from a jogging path along the river, which I appreciated. Everything was very clean. I was upgraded to a one-bedroom corner suite with full kitchen. Since it's a older building the rooms were sizable and there were lovely tall windows and I believe 10- or 11-foot ceilings.Unusually sunny for a hotel room. I could hear the elevator and street noise, but that's true of many hotels and the bedroom was buffered from the hallway by the kitchen and bathroom. The living room had a two-seater leather couch and club chair, which I don't find comfortable against skin, a desk with shelving, books and magazines, and a wall-mounted HDTV. There were a moderate number of channels, a couple of which dropped in and out. The room could have used reading lamps by the couch and chair, and if the couch were longer it would have been more comfortable for stretching out. The free Wifi was reliable on a weekend but dropped in and out on weekdays. But I appreciated the size and tall ceilings and windows. There is a hall closet and the room was large enough to have guests or clients (although limited seating). Phone was in this room. I agree with others that the platform bed with thin mattress should be replaced, but I don't mind somewhat firm mattresses and it didn't prevent me sleeping. Plenty of pillows and an extra blanket. Neither of the bedside reading lamps worked (unless I failed to figure out the switches) and it was late so I didn't bother to ask for help. But there was a sizable bedroom closet with organizers (shelves, drawers) tucked inside it. There was a wall-mounted TV in the bedroom but no second phone. No bedside tables (no room). Ironing board, iron and full-length mirror. Nice bathroom with shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, sewing kit, shoe shine cloth and shower cap. Plenty of towels and soap. Sufficient shower pressure; toilet handle had to be held down to flush. Fancy glass bowl sink but not much space to lay down your things -- but there are shelves over the toilet. They served a complementary full breakfast in the bar, beginning at 7am. Scrambled (powder) eggs, meats, toast and other breads/pastries, yogurt, fruit, juice and coffee and tea. A great timesaver and hot food is always appreciated. The staff was very friendly and responsive, dealing immediately with a battery change in the TV remote and offering to bring ice. They patiently answered all my questions and directed me to a nearby 24/7 Duane Reade and deli. I got all wake-up calls on time and housekeeping didn't disturb. I would stay here again. It's definitely quieter and less crowded than other parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, overpriced but reasonable for NYC...”
Reviews.Author: floridabrits
Reviews.Content: Love the wood floors (no disgusting carpet!) :-) Staff are super helpful and made us feel very welcome. Advertised as a boutique hotel, but they need to do a little more on room quality to meet that claim. Would stay again for convenience to Wall St Kudos to staff - they make it better than it is..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: nóinín
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the fourth of July weekend. We only booked it because our hostel closed down, but I'm glad we ended up here. It worked out cheaper than the hostel! It was easily accessible by taxi from the airport, being on the edge of Manhattan. When we arrived at 2pm, our room wasn't ready so we went for a walk. Wall street was just around the corner, and we managed to do a bit of sightseeing, and see Ground Zero before we headed back to the room. It was a great base for sightseeing. The room was lovely, clean and spacious (no view though). We found it hard to get the room to a comfortable temperature and the air con was quite loud at night. There was a mini bar (reasonably priced as mini bars go) and coffee available in the room (but no tea!). Breakfast was nice, but pretty much the same every morning. There was a quiet bar downstairs too. Staff were nice and helpful. They recommended some good places to eat nearby. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Serenity in the buzz of downtown NYC. Will stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: Maks0302
Reviews.Content: Friendly and quiet for couples who want to find each other. Accessible through train from the aiport. Easy to move from - to any parts of NYC to those who want to acquaint themselves with NYC using public transport. However, be warned that breakfast is one and the same (not bad). It can be monotonous if you are staying for more than 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMao
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights while on business. The location was good as my meetings were at the World Financial Center. It was only a 15 minute walk. However, at night it is a bit quiet although I never felt unsafe. Can be quite hard to get a cab in front of the hotel although the hotel staff walked a block and flagged down a cab for me. I got a room with 2 Queen beds. It was gigantic. The bathroom was not fancy. There was tons of space in the room although they probably should repaint the ceilings as there was visible water damage. The room smelled a little damp. Overall the hotel wasn't impressive (the staff was). There are better choices in the area but the Eurostars is relatively affordable compared to others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: KeanieKeane
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute. We were very impressed as soon as we walked in the door. Friendly and helpful staff. Our room was big with high ceilings. We made coffee each morning. We also had a few drinks at the bar. There are some cute restaurants in the area as well as a convenience store and Starbucks. We always felt safe being in the financial district (lots of security around), and it was also great to escape the craziness of Times Square etc.

Reviews.Title: “Don't cash travelers checks”
Reviews.Author: RogueOfworlld
Reviews.Content: The level of customer service is sub standard. There seems to be the arrogance of the European waiter here. I have cashed Amex travelers checks throughout he world. Not here! Why, we do not have the software!!!!!! Fortunately this is the banking district and a bank is nearby. If you want convenience to meetings this works but it is overpriced and is not customer centric.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction guaranteed!!”
Reviews.Author: Msmom48
Reviews.Content: I just got home yesterday from NYC and stayed at Eurostars Wall Street. This place was great! I was there on business and it was literally a 2 minute walk from where I had to be. There is a mall only a 5 minute walk that has everything you could possibly need at any time. There is a Starbucks on the next corner block, a pharmacy within 5 minutes of walking. You can even walk to Chinatown which I did!! Great location and the staff was amazing! The guys that work at the front desk are very knowledgeable and friendly! They will get you anywhere you need to go the best possible route. I checked out and 20 minutes later had to go back in to use their computer area and not only did they remember me, but they had no problem letting me use the computer area even though I was no longer a guest there! I always got a 'Good Morning' and a 'Hello' when coming or going. They don't have a continental breakfast but I didn't really need breakfast since I brought my own stuff to munch on. No room service, but again, with everything so close, that was also not a problem. There was a small fridge and microwave in the room that could be used if need be. Very clean and comfy room ~ bigger than some places that I stayed in previously. I would recommend this place highly!!

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: karenann33
Reviews.Content: The location is ok depending on what you want to do. Not much going on in the financial district on the weekend, so quiet outside. There was a party in the hotel room nearby that was noisy. The party woke me up (1am getting kinda loud), but I think someone came up because the noise was less about 15 minutes later. There's a seaport closeby where you can take a water tour of the city and about a 15 minute walk to the harbor to catch a ferry to Ellis/Statue of Liberty. Subway stops are also close. There is some construction going on at the front of the hotel, so the cabbie couldn't find it right away. The people were nice and friendly. They can't call a cab, but one guy flagged a cab for me (Front Street has little traffic, so he had to go up a block). The bed, as one person mentioned, is a bit hard. I'd call the hotel "sparse". The tv worked and it was clean (not overly spotless, but not a dump). For the price, it was pretty good. Hotels around that area are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: nana7sty
Reviews.Content: This is the type of place that you are afraid to let your feet touch the floor in. They don't even have real carpeting, it is some kind of burlap/velcro material that you stick to when you are walking. It's like something you would put on a makeshift porch of a trailer. The air conditioning doesn't work and the room is about 85 degrees right now. Yes, I am currently in it suffering all of it's horrors. Don't trust the pictures...I don't know how they made it look so nice online. And there is nothing cozy about it. It makes you wish you brought your own linens! In fact when I did a search on this hotel Google prefilled the words "bed bugs" after the name...I am not even going to click on it.

Reviews.Title: “On a good way to become a luxury boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hiiri
Reviews.Content: Don't let the facade and the state of the surrounding buildings shock you. There is still construction going on, but not as bad as elsewhere in the city. And the street itself is very quiet at night. I would not yet call it a 'luxury' boutique hotel, it still needs some work done. BUT: the rooms are very spacious (at least the executive guest room I was in), with high ceilings. The workstation is sufficiently spaced and there is an extremely comfortable office chair. The 'minimalistic' interior still has everything you need: flatscreen TV, microwave, fridge, coffeemaker, good assortment of snacks. (First time I have ever seen an 'intimacy kit' (condoms) and First Aid kit in a hotel room !) While some have commented that the beds are very hard, which is true, I appreciated that and found it to be just right. A MAJOR plus: free WiFi in the rooms (I really don't understand why most business hotels, including high priced ones, are still charging for it. These days it should be part of the room amenities.) Although the hotel has recently been renovated, the room already showed some wear and tear, including water damage on the bathroom ceiling and floor. But don't forget, this is a very old building. The lobby is modern, so is the bar area. The staff is very friendly and extremely helpfull. All in all a very good place and if they keep up the renovations it is well on it's way to become a true luxury boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - but....”
Reviews.Author: SpivsUKOK
Reviews.Content: I was put up here for one night having been "walked" by the hotel with which I had a reservation. First impressions not good as the receptionist was rather surly. The room was very poor indeed: tired decorations, a very uncomfortable bed with a pathetically thin matress and the sense that the furnishings had been bought for a completely different location. Bathroom in particular was rather grimy. To finish things off, the room eas very noisy with traffic sounds from early in the morning. Not in the least bit attractive or comfortable. There were two saving graces. First, the location is very, very central for Wall Street (although my taxi driver struggled to find it). Second, the self-service breakfast was good: nice room, reasonable choice and good coffee. So, if you want to have breakfast in a good location this would be a good bet. But ot so good if you like comfortable room and a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Telechubbi
Reviews.Content: The staff were great. All our requests were met promptly by very friendly staff. The 5 of us stayed in a Double 2 Queen bed room with a roll away. The room was huge, about 300sqft. There was enough space for all our luggage. However, the room do look worn and more hard work is needed to clean the room and the bathroom. I suggest they use bleach. I didn't like the feel of the rough carpet against my feet. The mattresses weren't great either, I felt the springs on all the beds especially the roll away. Very close to Wall Street with easy access to Staten Ferry. The nearest subway is only 5 minutes walk away and from there, only 10 minutes (at most) to Times Square. Only 10 minutes walk away to the bottom of Broadway where all the shops are.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: kinzeesmom
Reviews.Content: Wow! Eurostars has far exceeded our expectations! Everything is just fabulous here. The decor is modern and trendy. There is a hip little bar near the lobby. Check in was a breeze. Our room is fabulous, clean, very roomy and a really comfy bed. Aside from all of that, the staff really sets this hotel apart. Lamont and Jose are so friendly and helpful. Suggestion after suggestion, directions and they were not waiting for a tip (even though we were happy to give them one) It is in the financial district, so there is not a lot going on, but for us it was perfect b/c it was a nice clean, safe area and it is nice and quiet for a good night's sleep. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as the website will lead you to think...”
Reviews.Author: amandapanda54
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I could get a free night with my airline points. From the website it looked very modern and trendy. Upon arrival I was surprised at what I saw. The website pictures were obviously taken a couple years ago. The lobby was plain looking and the furniture worn. Our room was large and had a full kitchen, but the carpet was rough and stained. The bed was the hardest thing I have ever slept on in my life-talk about a quick way to ruin a vacation. The towels were also rougher than I have had in most hotels, and they didn't give us new ones after our first night (which we didn't realize until the following morning when we went to shower). The lounge was supposed to be open Monday through Friday, but when we went to have a drink Friday night we found the doors closed. It was fine for a free night, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First and Last Time!”
Reviews.Author: Roanoke
Reviews.Content: The location was good for my meeting at the Exchange, however, this is definitely not a hotel for executives. My major complaints were the futon-style bed and no food service of any kind. After traveling for 6 hours and arriving at the hotel late at night, I ate peanuts for dinner! Also, I'm not sure why our company was charged $499 for a room here, when others are saying they were charged in the $200 range. You can get a room at the Ritz for $499, however, they were full the night I was in town. Next time the Ritz is unavailable, I'll stay at the Embassy Suites and take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “good valvue for the money”
Reviews.Author: lginnane
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for my birthday in June and the room was very large for NYC standards. We had a large fully equipped kitchen and a nice size living room. We had two plasma tvs one in the living room and one in the bedroom which was very nice. The bathroom was clean and modern but the towels were small and not very soft. We had a buffet breakfast which was included in the price and it was fine with ceral toast muffins juice and scrambled eggs and bacon. All in all we enjoyed our stay and we thought it was very good valvue for the money. We enjoyed being so close to the South Street Seaport and the subway for uptown was two blocks away. We would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Large Room, Close to Wall Street”
Reviews.Author: JC2
Reviews.Content: Your taxi driver might not be able to find this place, so print out a map of the Financial District before you leave home. The rooms are very large by NY standards and include a fridge and microwave. The bathroom is big and modern. There is a seating area along with two double beds and extra room to spare. It's not a bad choice if you are in NY for business on and near Wall Street, otherwise I can't think of any reason to stay in this part of NY. Unfortunately, the biggest drawback is the noise from the street below. The street is not that busy, but you can hear noise from delivery and garbage trucks below.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Wall St alternative”
Reviews.Author: boston02118
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, primarily because of its location near Wall St. Small lobby, friendly and attentive staff. The ambiance approached that of a boutique hotel but the facilities fell short of the amenities that you expect in such a hotel. The room was large with a comfortable armchair. Didn't like the futon-style mattress (my days of sleeping on a futon mattress were over a long time ago). No exercise facility on site and the wireless service was spotty (a colleague I was traveling with also experienced less than optimal wireless). Overall, for one night, the hotel was a good choice, primarily because of its location near my meeting near Wall St. And the price was very good ($229). But i wouldn't want to spend more than one night here. I'd prefer a full service hotel or a true boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two-star and not "boutique" by any stretch”
Reviews.Author: PaulGofBoston
Reviews.Content: In an effort to save my multi-national bank some money, I decided to stay here on my last business trip to New York. This hotels is passable, but if you're an executuve type, you're not going to like it. This hotel used to be called the Exchange Hotel (see Trip Advisor reviews accordingly). The staff was fine. The room was a bit odd, synthetic carpet tiles were old and used, and the bed (like other reviewers comments) was a single mattress on a "trend" bedframe. The mattress was next to sleeping on a rock (and I don't complain, so if I am writing this review, it means I actually took the time to care and forewarn you). The hotel itself if slightly run down, although if you visit the Eurostars site, they lead to you to believe that you're staying at an upscale "boutique" hotel - this is by all means a stretch. During my three day stay, the lobby lounge was uninviting with it's blaring rap (yep, rap) music. The morning free breakfast was OK, but nothing great. The location us great if you're working on Wall Street or in the near vicinity. Otherwise, Gild Hall, the Hilton Millenium are better business travel choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: businessman425
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of the financial and Seaport district. The hotel was tastefully appointed and had a great breakfast buffet. The staff was exceptional, especially Arturo Guerra at the Front Desk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!!!”
Reviews.Author: HarrietGREEN
Reviews.Content: Great location. The perfect location to see NYC. Very quiet at the weekend. Open top tour bus is the best way to travel because of value for money. City Sights NY was perfect. There is a bus stop a stone's throw from the hotel and the tube is one street up. The hotel breakfast didn't look great so we just ate out around. This wasn't a problem though as there are tons of yummy diners and cafes nearby. A&F is only down the road and tons of lovely restaurants too in a cobled street waterside area. Feels very european and classy (a nice contract from the brashness of time square). The breakfast was the only disappointing thing about the hotel and we didn't eat it (may have been better than it looked). I would recommend going room only though. The prices are incredible, given the size of the room and quality of the hotel. Very stylish and boutique feel. We were upgraded. It was my friends 30th. We stayed in room 805. Surely the best room in the hotel. As big as my sitting room and lounge put together!! I though NYC rooms were sposed to be small?!!!!?? Two massive double beds, a leather couch, a desk area. Bathroom didn't really match up with the 5 star standard of the room but it was pleasant and clean and well appointed. Staff were friendly but left you to be independant. Perfect! Free internet and computer = a definate plus. We booked through Late rooms and paid 100-150 pounds a night. 50-70 each. What a bargain!!! I would definately go back to Eurostars when in NYC. I don't even think the big hotels (where you pay 4 times as much) would come close to comparing in value for money, location and style. Book this now or you'll regret it. Prices are jumping up week after week.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars Wall Street
HotelInfo.Address: 129 Front St, New York City, NY 10005
